derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from Portuguese marmelada 'quince jam', from marmelo 'quince', based on Greek melimēlon (from meli 'honey' + mēlon 'apple')

entry.def: Marmalade is a food made from oranges, lemons, or grapefruit that is similar to jam. It is eaten on bread or toast at breakfast.

means.word_mean: 1. a preserve made of the pulp and rind of citrus fruits
